etymology.description: semantic: 氵 (water) + phonetic: 難 (simplified 难)
etymology.interpretation: The water radical signals a meaning connected to bodies of water and shorelines. 難/难 serves as the phonetic element (historically related in sound), while the watery radical carries the sense of shoals, sandbanks, and beaches.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing the phonetic 難 with its simplified form 难 to reduce strokes; the water radical was retained, so the meaning stays the same.

examples.chinese: 河水退去后露出沙滩(河水退去後露出沙灘)。
examples.english: After the river recedes, a sandbank emerges.

examples.chinese: 我们在海滩上散步(我們在海灘上散步)。
examples.english: We take a walk on the beach.

examples.chinese: 船靠近河滩时要小心浅滩(船靠近河灘時要小心淺灘)。
examples.pinyin: Chuán kàojìn hétān shí yào xiǎoxīn qiǎntān.
examples.english: Be careful of shallow shoals when the boat nears the river shoal.
